titleStmt.title: Alfred E. Shannon to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2320

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Austin, Lander County Nevada
Dec 2nd 1865
To His Excellency
the Governor of Kentucky
Dear Sir
The undersigned a Notary Public for Lander County State of Nevada, and commissioner for many states of the Union would respectfully solicit a commission for the state of Kentucky
The emigration to this Land of silver brings -- together men from all parts of the Union, and they are at a loss to make conveyances & C. before proper officers to return to the old states
A want of the Statutes of each state in this newly settled country, renders it impossible to say who is -- qualified to take acknowledgments.
I Can now only add that in seeking this appointment that in politics, I am and always have been a strict Union man

Respectfully your Obt Servant
Alfred E Shannon
I can refer you to Hon D R Ashley, Member of Congress for Nevada

Comr of Deeds
Nevada
Alfred E, Shannon
comd
26th Dec 1865
